title: Arthur Fery's Surprise Victory at the Australian Open
summary: Arthur Fery, a British qualifier ranked 186th in the world, caused a significant upset on the first day of the Australian Open by defeating 20th seed Flavio Cobolli. The match, held at Melbourne Park, ended with a score of 7-6 (7-1) 6-4 6-1, marking Fery's biggest career win and his overseas Grand Slam main-draw debut. Cobolli struggled with a stomach issue, affecting his performance. Fery has a history of beating 20th seeds, having previously ousted Alexei Popyrin at Wimbledon. He expressed enjoyment for playing on major stages. Additionally, British player Cameron Norrie won his match in five sets against Benjamin Bonzi. Fery's background includes supportive parents with sports and business experience, which he credits for his success. His mother, a former professional player, watched him debut in Melbourne.
